article.headline: Vermont 67, Binghamton 60
article.story: VESTAL, N.Y. (AP) -- T.J. Sorrentine scored 27 points to lead Vermont past Binghamton 67-60 Friday night. Sorrentine scored 17 of his points in the first half, helping Vermont to a 35-27 lead at halftime. In the second half, Binghamton rallied with a 20-6 run to tie the score at 52 with 5:50 left. But the Catamounts regained the lead and sank six free throws in the final two minutes to secure the win. Nick Billings led the Bearcats (4-7, 0-1 America East) with 20 points, 11 rebounds, and seven blocks. Troy Hailey, Alex Adediran and Louie Karis each added 11 points. Coppenrath had 15 points and 11 rebounds for Vermont (4-5, 1-0).
